Soaked rice 1-1/2 cups 

Chicken ½ kg 

Chicken mince 1/4 cup 

Salt to taste 

Turmeric powder 1 tsp 

Red chilli powder 1 tsp 

Garam masala powder 1 tsp 

Garlic paste 1 tbsp 

Ginger paste 1 tbsp 

Yogurt 1 cup 

Oil 2 tbsp 

Ghee 4 tbsp 

Cumin seeds 1 tsp 

Cinnamon 1 inch stick 

Black cardamoms 2 

Green cardamoms 5 

Cloves 6 

Sliced onions 3 medium 

Potato (½ inch cubes) 1 large 

Chopped green chillies 4 

Chopped mint leaves 2 tbsp 

Saffron 8-10 strands 

Milk 2 tbsp

1. Add salt, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, garam masala powder, garlic paste and ginger paste to the chicken and mix. 

2. Add yogurt and oil and mix and leave to marinate. 

3. Heat ghee in a pan. 

4. Add cumin seeds, cinnamon, black cardamoms, green cardamoms, cloves and onions and sauté. 

5. Add chicken qeema and stir and continue to sauté. 

5. Break the qeema lumps with the ladle as you sauté. 

6. Add potato and sauté. Add salt, green chillies and chicken and stir well. 

7. Add mint leaves and rice and stir to mix well. 

8. Add water and mix. 

9. When the mixture comes to a boil, reduce heat and add saffron milk. 

10. Cover and cook till both the rice and chicken are cooked.
